14#pragma once
15
16#include <inttypes.h>
17#include <stdlib.h>
18
19#include <isc/lang.h>
20#include <isc/types.h>
21
22/*! \file isc/random.h
23 * \brief Implements wrapper around a non-cryptographically secure
24 * pseudo-random number generator.
25 *
26 */
27
28ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
29
30uint8_t
31isc_random8(void);
32/*!<
33 * \brief Returns a single 8-bit random value.
34 */
35
36uint16_t
37isc_random16(void);
38/*!<
39 * \brief Returns a single 16-bit random value.
40 */
41
42uint32_t
43isc_random32(void);
44/*!<
45 * \brief Returns a single 32-bit random value.
46 */
47
48void
49isc_random_buf(void *buf, size_t buflen);
50/*!<
51 * \brief Fills the region buf of length buflen with random data.
52 */
53
54uint32_t
55isc_random_uniform(uint32_t upper_bound);
56/*!<
57 * \brief Will return a single 32-bit value, uniformly distributed but
58 * less than upper_bound. This is recommended over
59 * constructions like ``isc_random() % upper_bound'' as it
60 * avoids "modulo bias" when the upper bound is not a power of
61 * two. In the worst case, this function may require multiple
62 * iterations to ensure uniformity.
63 */
64
65ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
66
